DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effectiveness MEN Count intervention , HIV intervention prevention program heterosexual Black men . The MEN Count model integrate HIV risk reduction gender-equity counsel housing employment case management via multiple one-on-one session deliver peer case manager 60-90 day period . MEN Count develop pilot test use CBPR approach via funding NIH R21 , Boston , MA . A large scale , two-armed quasi-experimental control trial design use test MEN Count among Black men recruited/enrolled STD clinic community-recruitment method Washington , DC . Study participant ( N=504 ) Black men report heterosexual risk HIV [ unprotected sex woman 2+ female sex partner past 6 month ] either current unemployment homeless past 6 month . To evaluate effectiveness MEN Count , two-armed quasi-experimental design conduct participant receive either MEN Count attention comparison program similar MEN Count structure . We assess program impact reduction number unprotected sex episode incident case STI ( Chlamydia , gonorrhea , syphilis ) via survey STI testing , respectively , baseline 6 12 month follow-up . Additionally , quality assurance process evaluation effort conduct ensure high quality program adherence delivery , well support program replication model prove effective .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Structural Behavioral HIV Risk Reduction Program Black Men
DOC.criteria: Black men age 18 old , report heterosexual risk HIV [ unprotected sex woman 2+ female sex partner past 6 month ] either current unemployment homeless past 6 month .
